title: Grazing Management  NDSU Extension Spring 2021 Horse Management Webinar Series

tasks.task: Participants must attend a horse grazing management webinar featuring expert presenters from NDSU Extension.
subtasks: Listen to Kevin Sedvik discuss grazing management concepts applicable to horses, cattle, and sheep.
Identify common grasses in North Dakota horse pastures, including smooth bromegrass, Kentucky bluegrass, Crested wheatgrass, and quack grass.
Understand the impact of fertilizer on pasture productivity and learn proper fertilization timing and rates (40-80 lbs actual nitrogen per acre, mid-April to early May).
Recognize toxic weeds and trees (maple, chokecherry, locoweed, horsetail) that may affect horse health and management strategies.
Learn about rotational grazing, dormant seeding (mid-October to early November), and overseeding techniques for maintaining pasture health and longevity.
Discuss the importance of mineral testing and adjusting pasture management practices based on soil fertility, grass species, and local climate.

tasks.task: Participants must attend a horse grazing management webinar featuring expert presenters from NDSU Extension.
Manage horse pastures by implementing grazing practices.
Manage horse pastures to optimize grass health, productivity, and safety.
Managing horse pastures, including fertilizing, planting, rotational grazing, and weed control.
